name: Aussie B's in Geography Quiz | Australia | 10 Questions

questions.text: We're in northern New South Wales at the mouth of the Richmond River.  Where are we?
questions.explanation:
Ballina.

	Ballina is a great fishing spot, just over 750 km north of Sydney and home to the "Big Prawn" which can be seen from kilometres away!

questions.text: We're on the banks of the Wakefield River in South Australia, 91 km from Adelaide.  Where are we?
questions.explanation:
Balaklava.

	Balaklava is situated on the northern edge of the Adelaide Plains.  A small town with a number of attractive sandstone buildings and a large "Keep Left" sign in the middle of the town which has an overhead powerline coming down to it!

questions.text: We're in Western Australia, 189 km south of Perth at the junction of two rivers.  Where are we?
questions.explanation:
Bunbury.

	Bunbury is the third largest town in Western Australia, situated at the junction of the Preston and Collie Rivers, it is a popular tourist destination with views to the Darling Ranges.

questions.text: We're in an area of New South Wales between the sea and the Kosciuszko snowfields at the junction of two highways.  Where are we?
questions.explanation:
Bega.

	Bega is famous for its cheese!  It is situated at the junction of the Princes and Snowy Mountains Highways, which join Sydney, Melbourne and Canberra.

questions.text: We're in one of Victoria's most famous gold-mining towns.  Where are we?
questions.explanation:
Bendigo.

	Officially named Bendigo (after a bare-knuckle boxer) in 1891, its gold rush began in 1851 and gold production there continued for the next century.  Bendigo is also renowned for its pottery.

questions.text: We're in the "Apple Isle", Tasmania.  183 km north-west of Launceston.  Where are we?
questions.explanation:
Boat Harbour.

	A beautiful beachside town settled in the 1830's, 30 km from Burnie.  The white sand of Boat Harbour's beaches is attributed to the quartzite rocks which make up the coastline.

questions.text: We're in Queensland, midway between Brisbane and the Gold Coast, between the Logan and Albert Rivers.  Where are we?
questions.explanation:
Beenleigh.

	Well known for its Rum Distillery, Beenleigh was first settled in 1864, when the Distillery was built.  It was named after an area in Devon, England.

questions.text: We're in Tasmania, the "Holiday Isle", 43 km from Launceston.  Where are we?
questions.explanation:
Beaconsfield.

	Situated in one of the apple growing districts of Tasmania's north-east, Beaconsfield was named in honour of the Prime Minister of Great Britain, Benjamin Disraeli, the Earl of Beaconsfield.

questions.text: Back to Queensland, we're halfway between Mackay and Townsville in a place named after Queensland's first Governor.  Where are we?
questions.explanation:
Bowen.

	Bowen is located 1,165 km from Brisbane and 206 km south of Townsville.  Captain Cook passed within 9 km of the coastline off Bowen.  In 1861 Bowen was officially named the northernmost town in Queensland!

questions.text: We're on the south coast of New South Wales, 23 km south of Montague Island.  Where are we?
questions.explanation:
Bermagui.

	All forms of fishing can be partaken of in Bermagui, 378 km south of Sydney.  It was popularised for its fishing by US novelist Zane Grey in the 1930's!
